name: Duranta
climate: Duranta thrives in tropical climates with warm temperatures year-round.
It can be grown in subtropical regions, but may require protection in winter.
While tolerant of heat, it does not thrive in cold or frost conditions.
In cooler climates, it is often grown as an annual or in a greenhouse.
sunlight: Duranta requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
Full sun exposure promotes abundant flowering and dense foliage.
In areas with intense heat, some midday shade can be beneficial.
Lack of enough sunlight can result in leggy growth and fewer blooms.
watering: Duranta prefers well-drained soil and regular watering to thrive.
It is drought-tolerant once established but should not be waterlogged.
Water more frequently during dry spells to prevent wilting or stress.
Reduce watering during the winter months in cooler climates.
soil: Duranta grows best in fertile, well-draining soil with good organic content.
It tolerates a range of soil types but prefers slightly acidic to neutral pH.
Heavy clay soils should be amended to improve drainage and aeration.
Regularly replenish the top layer of soil with compost to boost nutrients.
toxic: Duranta berries and leaves are toxic if ingested by humans or pets.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage dense, bushy growth.
Apply a balanced fertilizer in early spring to promote flowering.
Monitor for pests such as aphids and spider mites, and treat promptly.
In frost-prone areas, consider container growing to move plants indoors.
